00020 //used for most colors
00021 struct ColorStruct
00022 {
00023         BYTE R, G, B;
00024 
00025         void operator = (ColorStruct Color)
00026         {
00027                 R = Color.R;
00028                 G = Color.G;
00029                 B = Color.B;
00030         }
00031 
00032         ColorStruct()
00033         {
00034         }
00035 
00036         ColorStruct(BYTE _R, BYTE _G, BYTE _B)
00037         {
00038                 R = _R;
00039                 G = _G;
00040                 B = _B;
00041         }
00042 };

00079 //used for timed events, time measured in frames!
00080 class TimerStruct
00081 {
00082 public:
00083         int StartTime;
00084         int unknown;
00085         int TimeLeft;
00086 
00087         void Stop()
00088                 { this->StartTime = -1; this->TimeLeft = 0; }
00089 
00090         bool IsDone()
00091                 { return this->StartTime != -1 && this->GetTimeLeft() <= 0; }
00092 
00093         int GetTimeLeft()
00094                 JMP_STD(0x426630);
00095 
00096         void Start(int duration)
00097                 JMP_STD(0x46B640);
00098 
00099         void StartIfEmpty() // just sets start frame
00100                 JMP_STD(0x6CE2C0);
00101 };

00103 //also see FACING definitions
00104 struct FacingStruct
00105 {
00106         WORD Facing1; //current facing?
00107         WORD unused_2;
00108         WORD Facing2; //??
00109         WORD unused_6;
00110         TimerStruct Timer; //rotation?
00111         WORD ROT; //Rate of Turn. INI Value * 256
00112         WORD unused_16;
00113 
00114         DWORD GetFacing(DWORD *arg)
00115                 JMP_THIS(0x4C93D0);
00116 
00117         operator eDirection() const {
00118                 // <DCoder> I don't know how or what it does, but that's what the game uses
00119                 DWORD nessie;
00120                 this->GetFacing(&nessie); // mysterious facing value from the depths of the game
00121                 return (((nessie >> 7) + 1) >> 1) & 0xFF;
00122         }
00123 };
